body: Hi Abraham ! The original data set that Mike provided has the same values for every day of the year..additionally, the values for  06:30 to 12:30 for each those days is the same as 13:30 to 19:30..and additionally (again)..the value for diffuse radiation is assigned as a % of the direct-normal radiation..(see attached image #2). So, my assumption is that the entire radiation data set of 8760*2 values is based out of just 7 empirically measured values. All of this still doesn't explain why the plot will turn out that way. I think I have figured out a bug. I will put that in a separate post.. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/fZ7LFFJLJtO9R4W8mmL3EqJul81A7kVedIU7bRHj9NwwdZ28iLjM5E1Rk83fpub-8AO9zjPx31nT69j*jxOOlMDTsqFtnWUU/316201710159PM.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/fZ7LFFJLJtPHG09bRu90-8h4yGobNa8qF7o9M*EUxSWhjANoysGCo*3ncat7KbimEeQjnyVxbD98UgcT*edNi17liGfRqiHA/316201710734PM.png)
